bow: never realized how isolating postpartum is months about weeks pp and just need to get off of my chest how alone feel in motherhood as beautiful and addicting as my baby and our time together is my partner is having such hard time understanding how my hormones effect my day to day wellbeing and patience and overall happiness we ve been struggling so much since baby came being that postpartum depression hit me pretty hard and my attitude has been less than kind or patient with him it so frustrating because he just simply doesn get what this is like what the constant worry is like what the exhaustion with breastfeeding is like he doesn experience these emotions know having mom friends would be good for me and being around female energy is something seriously lacking but other moms are so hard to relate to convinced that in my experience at least dad doesn truly bond with baby until baby becomes bit more independent of me dad hardly even holds baby or feels comfortable being alone with him because baby tends to cry right away being that dad doesn fully understand his cues or what he likes on top of the typical anxiety and stress of being new mother constantly worry when baby alone with dad not that he incompetent or careless he loves our son every bit as much as do he just seems to have less patience and is not as attentive as am lately he seems to just want to bring baby to the nanny when gone can tell baby discomfort with him is giving him lot of anxiety don know what to do to help dad feel better around baby and also to stop breathing down dad neck every time he alone with little one feel like going crazy waiting for something terrible to happen when at work during the day really struggling here hear you new momma it can be really difficult for the other partner to get what we go through the only thing that helped my hubby was more time with the baby alone it really the only way for them to learn baby cues and let them bond for me the hardest part was trusting my hubby and not that he not the most amazing father he really truly is amazing with my little guy but it hard to let go of those mama bear instincts plus little bit of type so it was not easy literally had to talk it out to myself when left them alone sometimes just to have nice long shower nap or even just hike with the dogs understand him handing off to the nanny it seems easy and safe to him because he thinks the nanny knows better than him but in reality it really hindering his getting to know his baby and think that big thing that people do realize you give birth to complete stranger even you as mom are getting to know this little human and we tend to spend more time with them feeding have more time off at first so it looks like it easier for us to other people aka our spouses and they do understand we struggled figuring out these little ppl just as much as they do to top off everything ve said so far is ppd or ppa the hormones after birth can really mess with your head and it not joke if you have not yet please speak with your doctor about how you are feeling to make sure you are getting all the help you need good luck with everything you re in the thick of it and just remember nothing is permanent with babies and it truly does get easier with time and experience thank you so much these are definitely the words needed to hear you re welcome my guy is only months so remember that feeling at the beginning even have few friends with littles around the same age and it still did help that feeling of isolation especially in the middle of the night or at times of dark thoughts keep on being an awesome momma ♥️ thank you it true that most times the only person who can get us through those tough times are ourselves and our little ones good luck to you congratulations firstly sure you re super mama had the exact same issues with the father of my twin daughters amp it was extremely frustrating they really don grasp how we feel as new mothers already inexperienced amp gone through such full bodied change feel like anytime said anything to him or wanted to make sure things were done correctly for my own reassurance got met with boy who saw me as his enemy not the mother of his children anywho can say 100 on the other side my girls will be in february that it took over year for me to actually feel somewhat like myself again hormonal wise it really is hard amp struggled in solitude with my postpartum depression up until last year truly hope you fair better than me but was in hard mental place up until few months ago things really do get better amp firmly believe the universe makes no mistakes everything happened exactly the way it does for reason am so greatful for my little girls amp though all of the hard ship we faced did suck it was not in bain amp it truly has prepared us to take on this life 💫💫 hope you re well nana amp your future amp you little ones is bright as can be 💓💓 definitely check with your doctor my little is almost mos old and ve struggled hard ve been on two different meds for ppa and ppd thankfully my husband did pretty well understanding because struggled with anxiety and depression before baby and yes learning that your husband has daddy instincts and trusting those is hard too control freak and will admit it so that was so so hard you re not alone mama it is so isolating as much as denied admitting it have some ppd and am super emotional all the time husband was sympathetic at first and now is just tired of me crying he lets lo 9weeks cry and doesn console him as fast men often don understand how it effects the mom don think they naturally jump up to help either mine is also quick to hand lo off to others some do but they must have more nurturing than many others then they wonder why they don bond as easily 🤷🏼‍♀️ aw mine is weeks as well incredibly emotional too and it tough when you don have women in your corner to visit or get you out of the house and let you vent lot of men just don have that emotional knee jerk reaction like you said mean jump and run as soon as baby crying it just different for them which hate that we have to just deal with that and accept it thank you so much it feels good to just simply hear that not the only one hope that it gets better soon thank you yes incredibly controlling and know it drives dad mad too understanding that not patronizing him or demeaning him that just worry and care for the baby is so important for dads to get too was prescribed zoloft but typically hate medicating so staying on low dose and working through therapy most importantly it certainly tough and definitely an adjustment for all was on zoloft pre pregnancy then put back onto it immediately after for anxiety was recently switched to prozac because the zoloft did even touch my depression yeah feel like zoloft has never done crap for me need something to target my anxiety more specifically the anxiety is the real kicker when it comes to my irritability and explosiveness it helped me before but my husband and have talked about it and we both think prozac has helped me in way that zoloft never has can only describe it as feeling like kid again little bit more sensitive at times but overall it is helped me so much more than expected think my low point was when threw my empty water squirt bottle the one for post partum potty time at my husband because he was helping enough it was an empty soft plastic bottle so knew it would hurt him ve never behaved that way before or since was just so frustrated and sore not normally violent person and immediately apologized for him it was wake up call that paternity leave is not video gaming vacation do advocate doing that but try to be clear about how you re feeling and what you specifically need from him for me it was even thirty minutes to nap or couple of hours to go shopping or lots of snuggles oh babe threw remote at mine which of course regret and apologized immediately after too the best way can describe how got to that point was just feeling entirely helpless and then stepped on while was down being in the pits of chaotic hormones bouncing everywhere and then having man who will never understand in your ear is rough which is why here to find some advice for escaping that frustrating never ending black hole of begging to be understood communication is absolutely key though you re right guess for me is that my husband and tend to both beg for understanding without trying to understand the other person with us both being so stubborn it makes this entire experience all the more maddening it is really hard is it remember having to mindfully bite my tongue all the time as watched husband interact with our first in the end it was more important that he find the time and space to figure out what our son liked and needed without me correcting him all the time sometimes that meant letting them be uncomfortable together and that was hard husband would get frustrated and lash out got quite few angry texts about where the stroller that was in the back of my car while was at water aerobics and it took long time for me to realize that he was angry about not being able to comfort the kid and not actually angry at me your husband probably wo ever truly understand the hormonal depression or anxiety but that does mean he does care or that he is also anxious or otherwise feeling off as you find your new normal as always do speak to your dr about finding the right resources for your therapy meds etc but also make sure to invite your husband in your head and heart too amp x200b you are absolutely not alone in those feelings postpartum is the most vulnerable time for all involved felt and still feel the exact same way the good news is once you get into the groove it gets better dad will get more comfortable with being solo with baby and you ll be able to take breath and feel like you re back on the same page or at least in the same chapter sleep deprivation is basically torture and only exacerbates the frustration joined mom support group in my area and it was such good feeling to just be around women in similar places in their life with their partner feelings and baby just know that you re doing fantastic job do what you need to do to feel better happy mom happy baby personally went back on medication and talked to counselor about my feelings and it made world of difference you re fully capable of motherhood and you re gon na make it out the other side of this new transition no doubt let start with making friends are you us or uk based search for local stay and play groups in your area your baby is going to play with other children yet but there are most definitely other mums in similar situations to you that you can speak to and make friends with secondly get your hubby to agree with you what his jobs are when he is at home with you and baby my husband has always had the job of burping the baby after have breast fed he has always had the job of bathing our kids and get them dressed after we have an year old son nearly year old daughter and another son due in 18 weeks he will have the same jobs again you will have to trust him to look after baby but it gives you space nobody knows exactly what to do when we become first time parents and it is learning experience for both parents stay strong thank you very thoughtful answer thought of myself as patient and understanding person in every way before becoming mother now it seems as though baby the only person receiving the best of me which know in my heart will change yes it just very hard thank you again yeah something we re really lucky about is that the sleep deprivation was short lived we ve definitely found our groove and routine so that the both of us still feel like we can take care of our basic needs shower rest decompress without feeling as though we re leaving the other person to struggle alone thank you so much have an appointment with new therapist finally scheduled and getting back on my meds have to remind myself that my partner needs me just as much as need him thank you immensely us based northern cali the jobs idea is wonderful advice and will definitely be taken to action appreciate you yes really like the jobs idea too it really good for them to own some baby care tasks and before you know it they re pro at those things and better at them than you my husband does 99 of the bath time too and think it become way for them to bond haven seen heard great results with zoloft for ppd with friends and patients alike you can ask to switch it your health your mental health and your livelihood don settle for whatever the first try medication is just because it prescribed to you doesn mean it the right fit for your brain chemistry ve seen new moms do serious 180 on different medications please consider it it only short term until you get back to normal it can take years to find the right ssri or snri for patients it road of trial and error paved with alot of patience mindfulness and meditation can be really helpful in letting go of some of the control issues you are facing as well as resentment towards your partner sadly this is very under reported and many moms suffer in silence as far as baby and dad go if you have any hope of them bonding the way you have with your babe you ve got to hand him the baby and encourage routine activities songs they can listen to together bath time really anything to create trust between the two it begins now don let this precious time slip by if he wants to be involved get massage do things for you self care is so so so vital at this time whatever it is take the time you decided to bring life into this world with someone you didn do it on your own this is time for support understanding mindfulness patience and love you re in this together the three of you honestly the right medication could change your day to day life in ways you may not think possible consider trying something else ve seen incredible success hope you feel better really soon ♥️ you are doing good get out of the house join moms group go to stroller size class anything and when dads home leave the baby with him just go resist the urge to take baby back when it cries resist the urge to tell him how to do it leave the house if you have to the lay way he can learn babies cues is to figure it out the same way you did and he won do it the same he ll do it different that what makes you mom and him dad ll tell you the day came home from the store and my man was shirtless with the baby wrapped up in the baby bjorn sleeping against his chest while he played video games it was amazing and he would have never figured that out if hadn left him to his own devices you are gunna worry mama don let that stop you from taking the time you need for yourself leave baby with dad amp go have dinner with your girlfriends second the not being able to comfort the kid part come downstairs after putting our older one to bed and husband would be this exasperated sweating angry mess because the baby wouldn stop crying remind him that she only baby and there no reason to be mad after he calmed down he would tell me that he wasn angry at her he was frustrated with himself for not being able to fix whatever was wrong with her or figure out what she needed think lot of men are problem solvers and fixers and when they can they feel like they ve failed yes plus it wintry and cold where at so we can always get out of the house during the day to get sunlight we re far enough from family to where they can just come by to visit for few hours hate having to deal with it and accept it too especially when not all men are like that see lot of posts about husbands being really involved and taking on tasks without being asked makes me resent having to ask or tell mine to do things second the men being fixers my husband does this all the time sometimes it sweet because know he trying to do what he can he ll run through list of baby needs when the baby is crying diaper gas tired touch food kinda thing and sometimes watch and bite my tongue because he ll think it one thing when think it different thing or he ll get frustrated when it seems to be none of the things sometimes baby gon na cry for no reason other than to have himself heard but ultimately he got ta figure it out for himself like recently baby has started to see more of the world around him he been getting distracted when being fed because he wants to look around and take in the world or wants to look up at who is feeding him and make sounds or faces just go with the flow feedings seems to have almost doubled in length because of this for me but it keeps the stress level down for me to just kinda roll with what baby is doing oh you want to look away and not suck sure ll try again in few husband think is trying to force baby attention too much to the bottle and has thus made baby frustrated with him at feedings it led to rough few days for him where my husband thinks baby is just having issues has diaper snot and that distracting him maybe he right not there in the room when he feeding him cus don want to be breathing down his neck just making my guess of what going on based on my experience and what hear over the baby monitor either way he got ta figure out how to deal with it his way felt the same way even had two other moms that were really close with me and had babies around the same time and it was still really lonely the worry was the worst part did put her down right can go pee without the dog sitting on licking her need to go outside but she can be in the sun can have beer to relax and not feel guilty that person sniffed are they sick should they be near the baby is it rude to ask them to not touch her it was awful my husband was great he really wanted to help but worried and would be tense when he held her didn sleep and when did would wake up in panic my only consolation to offer is that it gets so much better and soon too my daughter is months old and while still have waves of anxiety she sturdy her dad can do things with her we have semi solid routine down and she seems like she pretty happy if you can get out of the house that helped lot just walking around new places trails parks just getting fresh air made difference sorry mama but it going to get really fun you ll be ok your husband will understand and it ll get better for him too first off as working mom who gone through ppd and is proof that it can indeed last up to six years twice which is why my kids are almost eight years apart you need to get some help not the nanny talking therapy there are anti depressants that you can take even when breastfeeding and it really would help you to talk all this out with someone once or twice month it would help you with the anxiety as far as dad is concerned help you cope with the emotions you re feeling with the raging hormones and the depression eating at your mind and overall is good idea if you re struggling second you need to quit blaming yourself *and* quit blaming your husband you re both going through lot of changes right now both of you are having valid emotional responses no one really talks about how difficult post birth is all the tv shows and movies gloss it over or ignore it your friends probably do want to scare you etc or you just might not have believed it when you heard it ignored it yourself to the point where you forgot about it etc for whatever reason it usually comes as shock to many new parents how difficult this time period is third you will survive this it will get better the only questions are how long it will take and how much help you ll need to deal with your new reality have you told your doctor psychiatrist that they ca help you unless you re being totally 100 upfront with them firstly sorry you are having hard time it the part of baby making wish people would communicate about more was an anxious mess for weeks and worried wouldn come out of the sad worried cloud but did my husband bonded immediately he held that baby for the first time and looked at him with immense overpowering love didn wanted shower and nap and that baby to just sleep for while don put much stake in all that first moment stuff our love is our actions we do our best by our kids and love grows don think my husband ever really gets what it like today my sick toddler throws up all over me take him to the bath and calm my little bub down we play bring him back to dad in towel after being thrown up on and this clueless man lets this baby follow me to my closet to change try to explain that need minute as in it his turn to watch this kid and literally keep him away from me for minute he says he should like me more and say don care how much he likes you right now need minute he could ve just cried for minute so can have breather but no no breather for me because husband does not get the emotional toll of momming not really he is dad that said he generally extremely helpful and supportive and does wonderful job at being dad but he not mom he dad it am jealous of his dadness often your husband doesn sound like he being super supportive and that sucks things will get better for you soon you ll get this thing down and the anxiety should come down as your mom confidence grows mine did most moms find they get calmer and more relaxed as baby stop being potato and starts showing some goddamn appreciation if you re not feeling progress in the next couple weeks start pushing for time away from baby with dad taking the reins you should do that soon anyway leave baby and go to the store for twenty minutes or just step outside maybe for quick walk around the block also fought for bath time and trained my husband to let me have it but it was battle too get away and remind yourself you are whole person apart from your child and your life will regain balance soon hold that man accountable but reflect and plan tough conversations before you start them if possible say what you need tell him you re sad and anxious and struggling best of luck to you new momma you totally got this gt dad doesn truly bond with baby until baby becomes bit more independent of me dad hardly even holds baby or feels comfortable being alone with him because baby tends to cry right away being that dad doesn fully understand his cues or what he likes on top of the typical anxiety and stress of being new mother constantly worry when baby alone with dad not that he incompetent or careless he loves our son every bit as much as do he just seems to have less patience and is not as attentive as am this is purely function of practice not biologically predetermined by the sex of the parent if he spends time practicing taking care of the baby he will get better at it the baby will get comfortable with him and you will get more comfortable leaving them to it but if he does practice due to not making the effort not investing the time or you not relinquishing caregiving duties it will never happen ll bet if he *did* take on equal parenting responsibility you both realise it not all hormones making you anxious tired and irritable—that how hard it is to take care of newborn no matter your gender if he ca parent the least he can do is develop some empathy taking care of month old is *way* harder than working or whatever he spending his time on source have done 50 50 parenting with my husband since the beginning we have an equal bond with our daughter and we were *both* stressed overwhelmed irritable and sleep deprived constantly until she was like year old hahaha it is very hard spent lot of time alone in that first year and spent lot of time wearing pajama pants and tank top with my boobs hanging out watching tv crocheting became huge crutch to my mental health and binged lot of netflix and amazon prime if you feel like you can get yourself out of the house find some other moms you can spend time with it was incredible for me to get to go outside with my daughter and talk with other moms especially once my daughter got big enough to wander and play if you feel like you ca get out of the house much try to find friend who can come by during the day hopefully you find friend who you are comfortable being unshowered and in pajamas around because that the kind of friend you can ask to watch the baby while you shower an extra tip if you re having trouble getting your own showers in and do have friend who can come by to help with that make it habit to bathe your baby every other night and then pass lo over to your husband to get dressed and snuggle while you take your shower it actually way easier to bathe baby if they lay in your lap while you sit in the tub with them you just have to get your husband to come take the baby or have bouncer with towel next to the tub can agree with this more mine is 11 weeks feel free to pm me if you wan na chat on the east coast and lucky that my so worked with special needs kids for the last 10 years he knows that sometimes babies cry and there nothing you can do except change feed hold burp and that really it don get me wrong baby obviously fusses way less with me but the fact that he tries means the world to me know it hurts him sometimes that she won calm down and eventually just gives up with him whereas with me she super chill and quiet only the last week or two have noticed him getting better amp her just getting used to him she doesn fuss nearly as much as she used to with him so he learning her cues— and attribute it to the hours he on duty over night when he got her without me this is when he sends me up to sleep in my room during the day if he home he always gets the poop diapers if know she pooped say someone pooped for daddy as joke and he usually swoops in and takes her he also the one who takes me pumped milk ep and makes bottles for the next few feedings and finally he does her laundry— but fold it always wash and sanitize her bottles these tasks are great way not to feel resentment toward each other we were lucky my husband got weeks paternity leave would pump enough for bottle and when hub got up in the morning would take nap that left him to take care of the baby alone for hrs it was probably as good for him as it was for me he became master swaddler learned baby cues and got an opportunity to bond without me hovering of course not everyday was easy and some days could tell he was emotionally exhausted by the time he woke me up he stuck it out to the last minute each day though knowing how badly needed sleep think this forced solo time together was invaluable for our whole family don know your exact situation but maybe there is an opportunity to leave the two of them alone for few hours each week omg so funny because that exactly what came home to tonight lol thank you so much ll take that advice know how you feel mom friends are must at this stage because only they know exactly what you re going through had friend who had her baby on the exact day as me and we were able to text each other constantly while that not having my partner with me created will say that it does get better your husband will grow and learn it took my husband years to finally become the wonderful dad he is today because it took
